result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Transcript of Sentencing Hearing, September 8, 2022 (Digitally Recorded)
Def is set up to appear by zoom from Dodge on Nov 7;  Ct will need to dial into IP address 165.189.207.15 Ext 20104
Initial appearance on November 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:40 PM Defendant Roman Lee Fuqua appeared by video, in custody from ACJ.  Attorney Lynne Van Hollen appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 22CF13 and 22CF129.  Atty Brewer withdrew under the assumption that Atty Erdman would be taking cases.  Atty Erdman is now not in zoom.  JA coordinate with state and Atty to hear cases.
Initial appearance on September 15, 2022 at 11:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Roman Lee Fuqua
Current: PO Box 333, Cable, WI 54821 United States  (Effective: 08-11-2022)
Prior: 1313 W Main St. Apt C, Ashland, WI 54806

Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there. 
Def to have NO contact w/AMH or her residence, no abusive contact w/LM.

Initial appearance on September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:34 AM - 19 CF 191, 20 CF 6, 22 CF 129 - Defendant Roman Lee Fuqua in court, in custody.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 22 CF 129 - warrant & now quashed.  Def transported from Pierce Co.  Alternate PSI was done/filed/rev'd.  19 CF 191 & 20 CF 6 are here for sent today & parties ready to proceed to sent today.  Def thought atty would be here in person & def would like Atty here in person, ct adj's Sent today.  Bail in 19 CF 191 & 20 CF 6 is REVOKED.  22 CF 129 - St req Cash & n/c w/AMH & no abuse LM, absoll and Ct orders bail of $5000/sign, No contact w/AMH & her resid, no abusive w/LM, absol.  9/8 Sent hring & Atty to appear in person.  22 CF 129 - Rec'd copy of compl, given rt to atty & adv'd to contact SPD.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.   After hring concluded & attys disconnected, def cont to talk to Ct about cases, dispite Ct admonishing him that it was ex parte.
Bail/bond hearing on August 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Recv'd phone call from defs mother stating that def was picked up and in Pierce County.  Emailed ACJ to see what plan was for pick up.
